page.title: 01Shutford
page.content: A mainly rural area consisting of farmland and 3 small villages and a hamlet. The farms are generally small, less than 400 acres. Shutford (346 pop) is 7km west of Banbury. It lies in the parish of Swalcliffe. Balscott (136 pop) is 2km to the north of Shutford and lies in the parish of Wroxton. Shenington (174 pop) is 3 km to the north west of Shutford. Alkerton (47 pop). Alkerton and Shenington are now almost joined by a little ribbon development. The whole area is roughly 500 ft above sea level, in the county of Oxfordshire and administered by the Cherwell District Council
